column4: Hi, i'm running 10.10 and i can't get a nvidia 8600gt detected - can someone help?
what do you mean can't get it detected
ie. isn't recognized.. - i downloaded the drivers from nvidia.com and after running them it says no relevant hardware detected
why did you download drivers from nvidia.com when ubuntu packages  supported drivers

usually, when i install an nvidia card on ubuntu it will ask me whether i want to install proprietary 3rd party drivers. I didn't get this message, and when searching for additional drivers it didn't find any, so i went and did it myself...
no nvidia card in that list, just an intel
yeah, i know... that's my problem.. it's in the motherboard, the fan is running... and yet, isn't detected?
ok. :( ... one more question.. i'm trying to install boxee but software center says there is an error with apt... ?
unhandlable error. "there seems to be a programming error with aptdaemon..."
I've never seen that, is boxxee in the ubuntu repos
nope. however, it had no problems installing in the past... (not necessarily this ver.)
I'm wondering (without looking in detail) if the package version is the issue, or th erepo
i wouldn't know.. since this isn't from repo i would go with package version.. any way to check?
install something else from an ubuntu repo, if it works you can have reaosnalbe confidence the package manager is fine
thanks for your help. have a great day.
